comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: Let's go on with cryptocurrency scams in the blockchain space. Today we review copy-and-paste malware, phishing emails, Ponzi and pyramid schemes, and ransomware in details. Follow the link: https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1525030683177275392/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: There are several cryptocurrency scams in the blockchain space. Some of them include blackmail, fake exchanges, fake giveaways, social media phishing, copy-and-paste malware, phishing emails, Ponzi and pyramid schemes, and ransomware. Let's discuss: https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1524356743928729600/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: A little bit about Anti-Money Laundering (AML). Money laundering takes “dirty” money and turns it into clean money. This can be done by very different ways. For details you can take a look to https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1526163981555089408/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: Where can I stake NFTs?Most NFT staking opportunities come from play-to-earn games. MOBOX and Zookeeper are two examples. Some projects are also developing NFT staking ability on their platforms. For details take a look to https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1522490755687849984/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: Let's come back to AML. AML regulations help combat the washing of illegal funds. They are a requirement for centralized cryptocurrency exchanges to help keep customers safe and combat financial crime. For details please take a look to https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1526839932433715201/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: When we talk about NFT, we think of them as digital representations of art pieces and collectibles that could grow in value over time. But as the NFT market grows, members are exploring new use cases for their NFT collections. For details take a look to https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1521829735977955332/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: Why do we need AML in crypto? Improvements in AML benefit legitimate crypto users, although it does require extra effort and time investment by all parties. Find out the additional info at https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1527556657399705601/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: How and where your crypto is stored? There are many different types of crypto wallets that token holders can use to store crypto. But, they can generally be split into two broad categories: custodial and non-custodial wallets. Details are here: https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1528728456141348872/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: What is a non-custodial crypto wallet?A non-custodial crypto wallet is a wallet where only the holder possesses and controls the private keys. For users who want full control over their funds, non-custodial wallets are the best option.Details are here https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1529356951951396865/photo/1

comments.body: What is better: custodial wallet or non-custodial wallet? Take a look to pros and cons of custodial and non-custodial wallets (https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.one).Both wallet types are good to store your crypto assets. Most traders and investors use both in different situations.More information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1530107797316284417/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: When it comes to cryptocurrency, good storage is importante. From a security perspective, hardware wallets are unmatched. We’ll explain what they are, how they work, and why you should be using one. Details https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.oneMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1531209488216252417/photo/1

comments.author: yellowMoon_One
comments.body: ✨✨✨ Why should you use a hardware wallet? ✨✨✨A hardware wallet is like an impenetrable vault with a small slot. When the user wants to create a transaction that the network will accept, they push it through the slot. Go to https://facebook.com/yellowmoon.one for detailsMore information at https://twitter.com/Yellowmoon_one/status/1531894498393051138/photo/1
